meanings.definition: Having a high-pitched sound or quality, like that of tin.
meanings.sent1: The tinnier bell rang loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent2: Her voice sounded tinnier than usual after the cold.
meanings.sent3: The tinnier alarm clock made everyone jump out of bed.
meanings.sent4: The tinnier whistle of the kettle signaled tea time.
meanings.sent5: The tinnier chirping of the birds filled the morning air.

meanings.definition: Comparatively small or thin in size or substance.
meanings.sent1: The tinnier book was easier to carry in her bag.
meanings.sent2: His tinnier frame allowed him to squeeze through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent3: The tinnier slice of cake left her wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The tinnier thread was delicate but strong.
meanings.sent5: The tinnier puppy fit perfectly in her lap.
